For B you can specify a date OR number of days:
Lifecycle rules: Based on a specific date
When specifying an action in an S3 Lifecycle rule, you can specify a date when you want Amazon S3 to take the action. When the specific date arrives, Amazon S3 applies the action to all qualified objects (based on the filter criteria).
If you specify an S3 Lifecycle action with a date that is in the past, all qualified objects become immediately eligible for that Lifecycle action.

A media company uses Amazon DynamoDB to store metadata for its catalog of movies that are available to stream. Each media item contains user-facing content that includes a description of the media, a list of searchable tags, and other similar data. In addition, media items include a list of Amazon S3 key names that relate to movie files. The company stores these movie files in a single S3 bucket that has versioning enabled. The company uses Amazon CloudFront to serve these movie files.
The company has 100,000 media items, and each media item can have many different S3 objects that represent different encodings of the same media. S3 objects that belong to the same media item are grouped together under the same key prefix, which is a random unique ID.
Because of an expiring contract with a media provider, the company must remove 2,000 media items. The company must completely delete all DynamoDB keys and movie files on Amazon S3 that are related to these media items within 36 hours. The company must ensure that the content cannot be recovered.
Which combination of actions will meet these requirements? (Choose two.)

choices.A: Configure the DynamoDB table with a TTL field. Create and invoke an AWS Lambda function to perform a conditional update. Set the TTL field to the time of the contract's expiration on every affected media item.
choices.C: Write a script to perform a conditional delete on all the affected DynamoDB records.
choices.E: Write a script to delete objects from Amazon S3. Specify in each request a NoncurrentVersionExpiration property with a NoncurrentDays attribute set to 0.
choices.D: Temporarily suspend versioning on the S3 bucket. Create and invoke an AWS Lambda function that deletes affected objects. Reactivate versioning when the operation is complete.
choices.B: Configure an S3 Lifecycle object expiration rule that is based on the contract's expiration date.
